intro: Sesamum calycinum var. angustifolium, commonly known as the narrow-leaf sesame, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the Pedaliaceae family and is characterized by its slender, lance-shaped leaves and distinctive yellow flowers. The plant produces capsule fruits that contain small, oil-rich seeds used in traditional medicine and culinary applications. It thrives in well-drained soils and requires a warm, sunny climate for optimal growth. Its botanical features make it an important species in both horticultural and ethnobotanical studies.
